intro: Malacocarpus kavarikii, commonly known as the Kavarikii kahili, is a member of the Arecaceae family, native to Madagascar. It is a medium-sized palm characterized by its slender trunk and pinnate leaves that are often dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in panicles, which are followed by elongated, dark blue to black fruits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
